page.title: 05VILLAGE HALL MEETING POINTS
page.content: Neither village in our block now has a school, a shop or a rectory and the Village Hall fills in a very important gap as a meeting point for residents. The hall at{Cliffords Mesne,}once the village school, is used twice a week by a thriving{Play Group}which draws under 5's from a wide area. Friday night is a regular club night with a variety of events being organised.{The Sunday School}also meets there . The hall at{Aston Ingham}was built in 1921 and for many years was owned by the{Women's Institute.}It was made over to the village in 1981 but is still used by the Institute. Both halls are used at Elections and by organisations wishing to hold meetings. They are also available for private hire. Aston Ingham is at present improving the facilities.
